alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 05 at 10:07PM EST until February 06 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The Kentucky River near Heidelberg, affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Heidelberg...elevated river levels are occurring. ...A FLOOD ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...High water caused by excessive rainfall persists. * WHERE...The advisory is for the Kentucky River near Heidelberg. * WHEN...The advisory is in effect until late tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 12.5 feet by Thursday morning. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Listen to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for updated information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 2 AM Sunday.
